Title: Milks
Bio: This is a list of both animal and plant milks, and while this list may not be comprehensive of all plant milks, it does contain most of the widely used plant milks. Milk is known for a few things: being high in protein, fat, and lactose, as well as calcium, phosphorus, and B vitamins. The nutritional information provided here will be based on 8 fluid ounces

Hemp_Milk.name: Hemp_Milk
Hemp_Milk.Bio:
- C Tier
- Typically low in carbohydrates
- Decent source of complete protein
- Omega 3s: Inflammation Prevention
- Phosphorus: Growth, maintenance, DNA
- Calcium: Bone health
- Vitamin A: Eye Health
- Vitamin D: Maintains calcium and Phosphorus
- A bit less to offer than most plant milks.

Rice_Milk.name: Rice_Milk
Rice_Milk.Bio:
- D Tier
- Manganese: Enzyme Synthesis
- Calcium: Bone health
- Vitamin-B12: nerve function and dna
- Vitamin D: Maintains calcium and Phosphorus
- Vitamin A: Eye health
- Not likely to flare up allergies
- Higher in Sugar
- Contains very little protein

Sheep_Milk.name: Sheep_Milk
Sheep_Milk.Bio:
- A Tier
- Very high in protein and fat: most protein dense on this list
- Vitamin B12: nerve function and DNA
- Vitamin B2: Red Blood cell production
- Phosphorus: Growth, maintenance, DNA
- Calcium: Bone health
- Provides antioxidant and CLA benefits
- Not for lactose intollerant people or milk allergy

Cow_Milk.name: Cow_Milk
Cow_Milk.Bio:
- Top Tier
- Because of the options of whole, red. fat, low fat and skim milk: we have 4 possible fat levels and calorie levels
- Whole: 3.25%, RF: 2%, LF: 1%, Skim: 0%
- Higher in protein and sugar
- Vitamin B2: Red blood cell production
- Vitamin B12: Nerve function and DNA
- Phosphorus: Growth, maintenance, DNA
- Calcium: Bone health
- Vitamin D: Matinains calcium and phosphorus
- CLA (conjugated linoleic acid): Natural fat loss aid
- Good source of branched chain amino acids
- Not for lactose intolerance or Milk allergy

Camel_Milk.name: Camel_Milk
Camel_Milk.Bio:
- A Tier
- Lower in all macros than other animal milks
- Good source of protein per calorie
- Vit B1: Converts carbs into energy
- Vitamin B12: nerve function and DNA
- Calcium: Bone health
- Shown to improve insulin sensitivity
- Has antibackterial and antiviral benefits
- Usually not pasteurized; when raw may lead to infections.
- Not for lactose intolerance or milk allegy

Soy_Milk.name: Soy_Milk
Soy_Milk.Bio:
- B Tier
- Good source of protein
- Good source of copper: Energy production
- Manganese: Enzyme synthesis
- Selenium: Antioxidant, DNA
- Iron: Oxygen transfer
- Vitamin B6: Brain, nervous, and immune system.
- Shown to combat chronic inflammation.
- Shown to improve cholesterol levels
- Soy allergy
- May contain added sugars
- Believed to alter testosterone and estrogen levels: tests inconsistent

Almond_Milk.name: Almond_Milk
Almond_Milk.Bio:
- B Tier
- Vitamin E: Antioxidant, combats free radicals, benefits skin and heart health
- Calcium: Bone health
- Typically low in sugars
- Lacking in protein

Buffalo_Milk.name: Buffalo_Milk
Buffalo_Milk.Bio:
- A Tier
- More fatty than typical animal milk: 17g per cup; 150 cal from fat
- Used for brain and nervous function
- Allows for higher antioxidant content
- Higher in protein per gram
- Calcium: Bone health
- Phosphorus: Growth, maintenance, DNA
- Vitamin B12: Nerve function, DNA
- CLA (Comjugated Linoleic acid): natural trans fat: fat loss
- More likely to be from a grass fed source
- Not for lactose intolerance or milk allergy.

Goat_Milk.name: Goat_Milk
Goat_Milk.Bio:
- A Tier
- More protein and fat than cow milk
- Phosphorus: maintains calcium and phosphorus
- Calcium: Bone Health
- Potassium: Maintains Cellular fluid levels
- Vitamin B2: Red Blood cell production
- Vitamin D: maintains calcium and phosphorus
- CLA: Fat loss
- Oligosaccharides: Prebiotic- Gut bacteria
- Not for lactose intolerance or milk allergy

Oat_Milk.name: Oat_Milk
Oat_Milk.Bio:
- C Tier
- Calcium: Bone health
- Phosphorus: Growth, maintenance, DNA
- Potassium: Maintains Cellular Fluid Levels
- Vitamin A: Eye Health
- Vitamin D: Maintains Calcium and Phosphorus
- Vitamin B2: Red Blood cell production
- Vitamin B12: Nerve function and DNA
- Shown to benefit bone health
- Shown to lower LDL cholesterol levels
- Not a common allergen like other milks
- May be high in added sugars
- Very low in protein

Chocolate_Milk.name: Chocolate_Milk
Chocolate_Milk.Bio:
- C Tier
- Usually cow milk with more sugar
- Good amount of protein and fat
- Calcium: Bone health
- Phosphorus: Growth, maintainance, DNA
- Vitamin B12: Nerve function, DNA
- Vitamin D: maintains calcium and phosphorus
- Bone health, antioxidant and CLA Benefits
- Post-workout recovery drink
- Not for lactose intolerance or milk allergy
- Very high in sugar

Pea_Milk.name: Pea_Milk
Pea_Milk.Bio:
- B Tier
- When Unsweetened: Little to no sugar
- Great source of protein per calorie
- Protein per quantity similar to animal milks
- Rich in BCAA = Branch Chain Amino Acids (used for supplementation for other plant milks)
- Contains oil from marine algae: Omega 3s
- Vitamin-B12: Nerve function and DNA
- Calcium: Bone health
- Vitamin-D: Maintains calcium and phosphorus levels
- Iron: Oxygen transfer
- Many brands contain added sugars
- Homemade pea milk will not be fortified with vitamin as store bought will
- Protein not the most bioavailable

Coconut_Milk.name: Coconut_Milk
Coconut_Milk.Bio:
- B Tier
- Most calories from fat: Lauric Acid
- Aids with weightloss: used for energy
- Fiber: Digestive regulation
- Manganese: Enzyme synthesis
- Copper: Energy production
- Iron: Oxygen transfer
- Selenium: Antioxidant, DNA
- Magnesium: Muscle and nerve function
- Potassium: Maitains cellular fluid levels
- Zinc: Immune function, wound healing
- Improves overall cholesterol levels
- Reduces inflammation
- Has antiviral and antibacterial benefits.
- Calorically dense.
